intro: Galium kamtschaticum var. kamtschaticum, commonly known as the Kamchatka bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Eastern Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and are typically white or pale green, with five petals. Galium kamtschaticum var. kamtschaticum is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its resilience to cold temperatures.
